utilities.title: Tourist Utilities
utilities.visaInfoContent: Most Arab nationals can visit Malaysia visa-free for up to 90 days. For extended stays, visas must be obtained in advance from Malaysian diplomatic missions in your home country.
utilities.passportLossContent:
If you lose your passport in Malaysia:
1. Report to the nearest police station immediately
2. Contact your embassy or consulate
3. Submit a police report to your embassy to get emergency travel documentation
utilities.covidInfoContent: For the latest COVID-19 regulations and health advisories in Malaysia, visit the official Ministry of Health website or call their hotline at 03-8881 0200.
utilities.taxiServiceContent: Major taxi apps in Malaysia include Grab, MyCar, and EZCab. Traditional taxis are also available but always ensure they use a meter or agree on a price before starting your journey.
utilities.publicTransportContent:
Malaysia has extensive public transportation networks, including:
- MRT and LRT in Kuala Lumpur
- Bus services in major cities
- KTM Komuter train for intercity travel
Download the MyRapid app for schedules and routes.
utilities.airportInfoContent:
Malaysia's main international airports:
- Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA & KLIA2)
- Penang International Airport
- Kota Kinabalu International Airport
- Kuching International Airport
utilities.currencyContent: The Malaysian currency is Ringgit (RM). Money changers are available at airports, shopping malls, and tourist areas. Major credit cards are widely accepted in urban areas.
utilities.weatherContent: Malaysia has a tropical climate with temperatures between 21°C to 32°C year-round. The wet season on the east coast is from November to February, while the west coast experiences rainfall from April to October.
utilities.localCustomsContent: Malaysia is a multicultural country with diverse customs. When visiting places of worship, dress modestly. Remove shoes when entering homes and religious buildings. It's customary to use your right hand for giving and receiving.
utilities.timeZoneContent: Malaysia follows Malaysia Time (MYT), which is GMT+8. There is no daylight saving time observed.
utilities.tourismOfficesContent: Tourism Malaysia offices are located in major cities and tourist destinations throughout the country. Visit them for maps, brochures, and local travel advice.
utilities.halalContent: Malaysia has a comprehensive halal certification system managed by JAKIM. Look for the halal logo displayed at restaurants and food establishments. Most major shopping malls have designated prayer rooms (surau).
utilities.translationServicesContent: For professional translation services, contact the Malaysian Institute of Translation & Books (ITBM) at 03-4142 0100, or use translation apps like Google Translate which supports Arabic and Malay.
